metadata.title: CVE-2021-20317 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A corrupted timer tree caused thetask wakeup to be missing in the timerqueue_add function inlib/timerqueue.c. This flaw allows a local attacker with special userprivileges to cause a denial of service, slowing and eventually stoppingthe system while running OSP.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20317` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-generic - 4.15.0-166.174~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-166-lowlatency - 4.15.0-166.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-kvm - 4.4.0-1103.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1118-aws - 4.15.0-1118.125~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1129-azure - 4.15.0-1129.142~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-gcp - 4.15.0-1114.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1085-oracle - 4.15.0-1085.93~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-166.174~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1118.125~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1129.142~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1114.128~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1085.93~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
